title: The Moz Blog [SEO] - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Rand Fishkin February 15, 2005 Approaching the End of the PageRank Era Search Engines Even a great technological innovation like PageRank will eventually be supplanted. For a web information retreival model, PR has already had a remarkable long life, yet its downfall has been predicted across the web by some of the very best in the industry. Here'... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 14, 2005 The Speed of Link Growth Link Building Many have surmised that un-natural link building is reponsible for ranking issues. This may very well be true, as much of the evidence I've been able to review on the issue of sites in Google's sandbox have displayed similiar features. Links have typically come in fast and furious at... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 14, 2005 A Glossary of Information Retrieval Terminology Search Engines Many times when reading through complex threads, research papers or even blogs by some of the more advanced SEOs in the industry, I get lost in the meaning of terms and an entire paragraph or document can be lost to my ignorance. Luckily, great resources like the... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 13, 2005 What can WordNet be used for? Keyword Research WordNet is a lexical database (a collection of words) that has been used by major search engines and IR research projects for many years. The database can be accessed through Princeton University's website and even ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 12, 2005 Child Inheritance at Google Search Engines An incredibly revealing post on some theories about Google's changes over the past 12 months was first noted by TW. However, the quantity and quality of information p... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 12, 2005 SEO Links from Del.icio.us Link Building I've blogged previously on the subject of Del.icio.us, but this time I want to examine our own, specific field and the links that spring up from the tagging community. Del.icio.us has a large base of users, yet few of these issue SEO tags... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 11, 2005 Indexing Summit at SES NYC SEO Events At the end fo February, representatives from all four of the major search engines - Ask, Yahoo!, MSN & Google - will be attending a conference on the topic of search engine indexing. A fantastic ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 9, 2005 Understanding Fractal Summarization Search Engines A terrific paper by Christopher Yang & Fu Lee Wang of the Chinese University in Hong Kong that was mentioned by Orion in a threa... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 8, 2005 Steve Krug's Advanced Common Sense Design One of the first requirements for anyone considering building or operating a website should be Steve Krug's miraculous book - Don't Make Me Think. This short, 3-hour read has been next to my... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 8, 2005 Link-Content & Link-Clustering Conjectures Search Engines In a paper titled, Lexical and Semantic Clustering by Web Links, Filippo Menczer of the Dept. of Computer Science at Indiana University, sets out... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 5, 2005 Using Cluster-Based Engines to Discover Keywords & Themes Mobile SEO A list of clustering search engines can be used to help understand how the search engines are currently perceiving the links & topical nature of you... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 4, 2005 Back Door to Google Rankings Search Engines Google has been keeping new websites out of its top rankings positions for nearly 1 year. Sadly, this has made the results far less relevant for ordinary users. Google probably assumes (hopefully incorrectly) that their brand loyalty will never die and that the prevention of SEO t... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 4, 2005 Term Weight & Glasgow Weight vs. Keyword Density Search Engines For search engines, keyword density has long been held to be a reliable measure of the concentration of a particular keyword or phrase on a specific page. However, this method of mesurement has long been known in the scientific community to be a poor repres... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 3, 2005 Latent Semantic Analysis vs. Theming Search Engines Despite the possible duplicate content penalty, I'm going to reproduce (yes, word for word) a post I made earlier today on SEW to try to clear up some confusion about the relationship and mea...
